page.title: 08DYFFRYN GARDENS (2)
page.content: {The Gardens} Visitors will be delighted by the great variety of flowering displays. In front of the splendid Edwardian mansion, extend wide lawns with pools. The stately lines of yew trees are prominant and the tall clipped yew hedges enclose numerous small gardens, e.g. the Roman, Fuchsia and the Pool Gardens. A pair of wide herbaceous borders is a magnificent sight in Summer, lying along the walled Rose Garden. Broad grass glades set off the Arboretum, displaying a considerable collection of deciduous and coniferous trees. In Spring, bulbs carpet the area whilst in Autumn, the Japanese maples blaze with colour. Many flowers bloom in the Wild Flower Meadow with other wildlife. Towards the end of the house, there is a colourful heather garden, the largest in Wales.
